reviews.review_msg: Very good prof! His powerpoint slides are very detailed and the exams are fair. He talks pretty fast but the powerpoint slides are all uploaded on WebCT, so you barely have to take notes in class (The slides are THAT good) Exams are mostly based on powerpoint slides and tutorial articles.
Great prof, made a class that could have been boring interesting.  Talks to fast but as long as you understand his slides you will do well on the exams.

i agree that sometimes he spoke too fast and was hard to understand. i don't think it's necessary to take psyc 201 before taking this class, as they explain everything really thoroughly in tutorials. i didn't and got over 98%. i felt pretty overwhelmed by this class at the beginning, but the exams were really fair and pretty easy.

i agree that he talked pretty fast and was sometimes hard to understand, but overall i think this class was done really well. i don't agree that you should take psyc 201 before this class, as i didnt and i got over 98 %, they explain everything really well in tutorials. i had karen as my ta, and she was a really great ta.

A good first effort. Explains the concepts thoroughly and clearly, but he speaks much faster than the 10 syllables/second average and combined with an echo-prone lecture hall, it's hard to understand him. Tests are fair except for an inordinate emphasis on research methods. Make sure you take 201 (as I did) before you take this class with him.

Great prof: he's interested enough in what he's teaching that it can keep you interested, but not so interested that he's in a completely different world than his students.  Tutorials are invaluable: their learning curve is intense but not difficult, providing you've read the studies.  He's genuinely interested in helping you learn.  Recommended.

Really nice guy but talks waaaay too fast! Nobody can write anything down. Don't bother going to lecture just listen to the lec's online so that you can at least pause him. Good slides, but explanations can be really confusing. Be ready to memorize a lot of info!

One of the most influential instructors of my undergraduate career. Patient, clear, helpful, and amazingly knowledgeable about all things neuroscience. Her passion for research is clearly evident when she teaches. She has high expections, but that's only because she wants to see potential turn into success. I couldn't ask for a better professor!

Very personable and funny which made lectures interesting. Assignments and exams are fair and straightforward. If you do miss lectures, make sure to listen to the lecture recording at least because some of the lecture material aren't elaborated in the text. Overall, one of the best female professors I've had.

very nice prof and class. make things clear. notes drawing out important info from textbook. assignments were a bit difficult, but exams are fair-easy. not hard to get good mark with her. recommend this prof.
She is a really nice prof but the lectures were straight out of the text book, which made it boring. the assignments were kinda hard, exams are ok.
Bert was an amazing prof for PSYC 308. His lectures are entertaining and the assignments are interesting to do.

Was an extremely hard marker. After doing bad on the first take home exam, I got no comments on where I went wrong or where to improve (the other TAs did) so I had to set up a zoom meeting. He met with me and made me feel like crap but I had an idea of where to improve for next time. He graded me worse on the second exam. Avoid him as a TA.

Bert is definitely a character, super funny and sarcastic but very relatable. He is so knowledgeable about a variety of topics and is always open to talking to students. His lectures use examples that show up on the tests so it's helpful to attend. If you're ever confused, I definitely recommend going to him for extra help, he genuinely cares!
One of my favorite professors! He is a funny guy and his session is so informative! If you need help to write your paper, you should definitely go to him for advice :)

There is a paper which honestly wouldn't have been two bad if he actually had explained what his expectations on it were... but sadly he did not. His comments/feedback he gives is very sarcastic almost making you feel like an idiot. Lectures are very long and boring. He talks way to fast.

Absolutely loved this prof, highly recommend! His lectures are super interesting and he's super silly and #relatable. I personally studied off the textbook a lot but his lectures helped immensely with the cramming session. His exams are super straightforward and it's honestly an easy A course. This was my first easy A+!

definitely one of my favourite professors ever. he's hilarious and makes lecture very entertaining. his exams are really good - no trick questions, just tests your understanding of the material. very friendly and he will willingly spend hours with you if you need help (provided there are no students waiting). wish he taught more psyc courses!
He is nice and friendly. But he speaks too fast and refuse to use a mic. It is hard for non-native speaker to understand what he said.

Best prof I've ever had. Interesting, hilarious, and truly cares about his students. The class was at 830 am but I didn't miss a single one simply because he made lectures so fun. He makes every concept easily understandable. His tests are fair and show your knowledge, he doesn't try to trick his students. Wish he could be my prof for every course.

Awesome prof! Tests were all multiple choice and very fair. However, the criteria for the paper was a bit unclear, and the class average for it was 58%. Make sure you talk to your TA to clarify and ask questions!

The best prof I ever had, enjoyed each one and every class. He is a funny guy so lectures aren't boring, the entire class would be there every week even though participation is not mandatory. Had amazing time and would take all my classes with this prof until I graduate if such thing was possible!

Bert is hilarious. Seriously one of the BEST prof's I've EVER had at SFU. Even though this is his first time teaching a class he was awesome. For an 8:30 class I really enjoyed myself and always felt engaged. He was so funny and always kept the class entertained, even when the material was a bit dry. One of the best classes I have ever taken!

Bert was a great professor. He was funny and kept the class engaged 8:30 classes on possibly the driest topic in psychology. It was his first semester teaching the course and I can say that he didn't let any of us down. He could've been a bit more specific for the paper but other than that his exams ere very fair as long as you also read the text.

Bert is a real gem. I rarely go to 3 hour lectures especially those at 8:30am but his lectures were really interesting. He explains concepts so that they really do make sense and you can connect them to the real world. His tests were more than fair, all you really have to do is read the textbook. 100% would take a class with him again.

Bert is an amazing lecturer; he's always super engaged (even though class was at 8:30am) and you can tell he really cares about his students. Accessible office hours all around, and has a fun personality. Would definitely take a class with him again.

Overall, he was a great, chill, funny prof. Definitely made dry material more interesting. He made midterms fair and they allowed you to show your understanding for sure. I wish he was more clear about his assignment (it was marked quite harshly), but other than that no complains! Definitely take his class!!(was also really nice to late students :)

Professor Sager is the best professor Ive ever had. I hate morning classes and yet I always showed up to his 8:30 class because hes really good at explaining hard material in an easy fun way. His exams are pretty easy if you do the readings and review his slides. Hes very organized and you get tested on the material covered in the slides.

Bert is the most engaging prof I have had at SFU so far. He makes jokes throughout the class which keep you interested, and mentions all the important details needed for the exam. His exams are all multiple choice, and the lectures are sufficient enough to get a good grade in them.

Bert is probably the funniest and most interesting psychology professor I have taken thus far- such an awesome prof I wanted to make this review! He makes difficult content fun and easy to understand. His charisma and genuine interest in psychology really show in each lecture and makes the learning experience in his class sincerely enjoyable.

Bert is funny which helped make class really interesting, and did lots of demos to help students understand what he was talking about. Easy assignments are due in class every class, and demos and extra info aren't on the slides he gives you, so going to every class is a good idea.

Dr. Spalek is a fantastic professor! His recorded lectures are clear and easy to follow, and I really enjoyed his teaching style. He's also very nice and approachable, making it easy to ask questions when needed. The exams are straightforward, just study the material and review his study guides, and you'll be good to go. Highly recommend his class!

Really enjoyed 221. The content is super interesting, although his lectures can be a little monotonous. Our weekly multiple choice assignments only take a few minutes. He puts them together to create study guides for the exams which are super helpful. Exams are straight forward with really easy written sections. You just have to like the content.
loved the prof and the class super interesting material.
Loved this class and Prof Spalek. Difficult material but not too difficult that it isn't able to be understood. 10/10 would take again
Amazing class. Amazing professor. You can tell he cares about the subject he is teaching. Difficult material but show up and pay attention and you will succeed.

I loved this class. Professor Spalek truly cares about his students and is an amazing teacher. The content is so interesting and you can tell he has a passion for it. This class encapsulates very difficult material but if you pay attention it can be quite easy. Amazing professor would take again.

Although Tom is a good lecturer, I feel like the way he structures his lectures can be quite confusing at times. The course could have been a lot easier if he had just focused on what we actually needed to know. Class average was always at 60%, but at least the course is graded on a curve.

the prof was very nice but this class was really boring. had to memorize a lot of stuff for the exams because they were pretty much the only thing we were graded on. i heard a lot of people didn't pass so i feel lucky despite this class bringing my average down lol
Lectures were dry and kinda boring. Don't take the class if you are not a test-taker. 3 exams, 30% each. 10% participation by submitting little stuff on canvas. Class average was C+.
The final is tomorrow and I'm so freaked out. I'm doing well in this class but he grades on a curve. Beware.
Would not recommend taking Psyc 221 with this professor. Lectures were extremely boring and long. There are 3 exams total which were very difficult and graded tough.
His lectures are super boring and he's one of the worst professors I've ever had. No commitment to classes or anything else. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Memorize the STRUCTURE of the textbook. For his short answer he gives you the most vague instructions to "test recall", but it was more a test of figuring out what textbook section he wanted you to know the headings for. I got 95%+ on all the mc, but 60% on written bc I couldn't figure out what answers he wanted. Lectures are long, boring, useless.

There is a 5% participation mark which everyone can get. Quizzes are worth 20%. The lowest 2 are dropped. It is easy to score on these quizzes if your concepts are clear. Solving the study guide prior to the quiz definitely helps. Quizzes are mainly from the lecture slides, but reading book helps. For midterms read the book. Be attentive in class!

Lectures were very dry and boring, weekly quizzes, the final exam and midterm will save you - weekly quizzes will not. I would study very hard for his weekly quizzes and failed more than half of them. Interesting information but the way it was taught/explained made me dislike the class :/

Very dense lectures & you have to go to at least the beginning to do well on the quizzes, which you want to study hard for. Study guides get posted which you should focus on. Once you learn his testing/lecture style it gets easier to know what is important. Used textbook only to better understand concepts, skimmed the rest.

He is clear and provide extra examples for the concepts. Not so hard to get an A if you put effort on it. Easy 5 points if you do the homework weekly which require you to create a mc question and 20% of them would be used in your exam. Weekly short answer quizzes could be difficult but you can guess what is asked once you get familiar.

Extremely boring lecturer. He can barely get through all the slides and often goes over time. Only gives one short break during a three-hour lecture and most students leave. Those who are left don't pay attention.

pretty dull lecturer, especially considering this is a three hour lecture, but this course is not as hard as many make it seem. As long as you come to class and do the readings you should be fine, but apparently people like to slack off and blame it on the prof/course... I'm not saying he's great or even good, just not as bad as some think

Lectures were easy to follow, with a lot of simulations of past experiments used to help us understand concepts. a lot of people disliked the course b/c the class average was pretty low, but if you listen in lectures/take notes and read the textbook, you'll do fine in weekly quizzes (all written) and exams (all multiple choice) just study hard
If you want a PSYC course where you easily lose marks on grammar rather than getting tested on the course material, go ahead.

Tom is a real nice guy! He can be dry and dull during lecture but if you have questions he will be there for you! Quizzes every week and they add up too 25%. Tests are extremely difficult! You need to study to do well in this course! I really enjoyed Tom and would take another class with him

If you read the assigned chapter, you'll be fine. It takes a few hours to go through each chapter, so this class definitely takes up time. However, it is well organized, he does a lot of demos in class and there are no surprises on examinations. Also, 2 midterms and a final all non-cumulative. You only have to know 3-4 chapters per exam.
Quite difficult, but you can get through.

I thought this was a pretty difficult course with him, he makes the material more boring than it already is and his lectures are difficult to pay attention to. Plus, the pop quizzes can be tough if you're not keeping up with the readings and paying attention to the lectures. Avoid taking this course with him if you can.
Horrible prof. Makes class boring as hell, hard quizzes and exams. AVIOD.

One of the WORST professors I have had in my post secondary education. I am I firm believer that students grades are a reflection of the prof. Boring and monotone on a subject that is already less stimulating. Makes quizzes easy and test HARD. All M/C test but leaves ambiguity to fight your answer.. pretty sure M/C test s are a DEFINITIVE answer.

OK. You have to read the textbook for the exams. No question. His lectures aren't the most exciting and the way he covers the course, he talks way more about the experiments than the theory/practical stuff. Be sure to study that. Quizzes are really easy but the exams are much more difficult. And for this course, the curve is your friend.

Prof is boring. This is a study intensive course, if you don't do the readings you won't succeed. The pop quizzes are pretty easy you can manage them just by reading his lecture slides. Exams are not easy but if you study and read you can do really well.

I enjoyed this class and found it quite easy and comprehensive. If you want to do well, do the readings (hint: he provides an awesome study technique on the first day of class. I recommend trying it), go to classes (you have to, for the quizzes), and finally, understand the relationship between the theoretical approaches, theories, and researchers.

I wish Tom had engaged students a little more. A three-hour lecture on cognitive processes can get really dreadful. He lectures on Attention, yet he hardly ever gets it from his students as it is extremely hard to concentrate for the full three hours. Unfortunately, exams average very low, so your only hope to get a decent grade is the curve.

This class is horrible. Grades take FOREVER to come back. We basically got our first midterm marks back the week before our second midterm! And it's all MC! Who can't mark scantrons within a day? TA's are also unreliable and never available when supposed to be. Horrible, horrible, class

Tom is a terrible professor. Incredibly lazy, does not get back to emails, and takes forever to mark tests. Our final was a 40 question scantron and I got all of my essay marks back before this one. He does not deserve to be a professor.

Tom may be an okay person, but he's a lazy and boring teacher. Never answers emails, makes ridiculous tests that don't even make sense, and makes his lecture slides so dull. If you're a psych major and have to take this course, try to get it with someone else.

nice guy, you can tell he cares about the students and wants them to understand the material. this course is not impossible, quizzes almost every week which are easy marks as long as you keep up with the readings/notes. exams are on the harder side but if you dont cram and understand the material they are fine! study and you can ace it!

Tom seems like a nice guy, but he makes the lectures soooo boring. Most boring class I've ever taken. The slides are all over the place, and his voice is quite monotone. The quizzes are don't even cover what is taught in class.

Cruel,cruel...he mentioned at the beginning of the semester a girl who he still failed despite her having family troubles. Some may say he's trying to be fair to everyone, I say compassionless. He makes tests difficult and pedantic, also comes across as a cold person. Not worth taking a course with him!!!
I really dislike this guy. Cannot get through a lecture in class time - easily distracted, and his quizzes are a joke.

DO NOT TAKE A COURSE WITH THIS PRO!! If you really really have to take his class then study for the quiz! ( at the end of the course it worths 25% of your term) you will have 2 midterms (25%) and a final (25%). Forget about getting a good mark on his midterms.... but seriously DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!

I am currently taking his class and I admit I find him a bit monotone, however the class content is very interesting & you can tell he has a high interest & knowledge for the subject. I have e-mailed a few times and always receive a quick, helpful response. Quizzes easy if you keep up readings, motivates attendance. Yet to take a test though.

I found his exams pretty easy. All the questions could be found in the textbook, there was nothing tricky about them. I think Spalek talks in a monotone voice, but the content of the course is interesting so I was able to pay attention most of the time. I thought it was easy to get an A.

The only reason to attend this class is for the pop quizzes. They were reasonable but only because the TA's wrote them. His exams were ridiculously hard. I studied the whole book and memorized every single one of his practice questions and still felt like garbage after the final. Only take this class if you absolutely require it. I got a B

DO NOT TAKE A COURSE WITH THIS PROF. He is a nice enough person but is one of the most boring lecturers out there, and he sets the course up to fail students. The class average for ~300 students on exams was just over 50%, reading the textbook helps but he phrases questions such that no matter how hard you study exams are difficult to do well on.

Avoid this prof!! He literally sets out to make his students fail. His pop quizes were difficult and his exams even worse. Our class average was *30%* for majority of the term!! He actually blamed the class for our poor performance, because approx 150 students are all dumb right?!

Universities should not be allowed to have professors teaching lower division undergraduate courses that are made to make students fail. We are clearly educated kids if we've made it this far, why would you go out of your way to make everyone miserable? I would punch this professor in the face if I could. AVOID THIS CLASS

AVOID THIS PROF! has pop quizzes just to make you attend and do the readings. people would show up then leave if there was no quiz. makes exams super hard and you have to remember the people who did the stupidest studies. not an interesting class, and he is the WORST prof i have ever had! grade is based on 2 exams and quizzes.

His teaching style is a ok.. talks clearly.but the midterms are hard, be sure you read everything in the textbooks and know the  concepts really well. my class average was 55%. He actually told us he is a hard teacher at the very beginning of the semester!

His teaching style made it PAINFUL to go to class. He forces you to attend every lecture by making popquizzes worth a huge 20% of the grade! Very cocky and purposefully confusing. Basically acts like a jerk while teaching and doesn't really give you any useful information. AVOID!!!

I do like this prof, his tests are hard to seperate those who understand the concepts from those who haven't given much thought to the info being taught. For every experiment, know the significance of the results (like its implications). The exam has a lot of material from the text, so know the text! Very helpful prof so if stuck ask him after lec.

It's true, his midterms are a bit of a wakeup call. I'll save you the time and heartache with this: BE ABLE TO PROVIDE EXAMPLES OF THE MATERIAL COVERED -if you do this you will go a LONG way without learning the hard way - he tests your conceptual knowledge of concepts - not rote memory!

Not a fan of his teaching, although he is a very nice person.  He flies through material and then askes you some of the most complex MC questions I've ever encountered.  Definitely doesn't make a hard topic any easier.  I don't think he's cut out to be a prof.  If he wants us to understand in great detail, he should teach that detail to us.
he should be band from teaching

Nice guy, but he does not know how to teach. Exams are designed for everyone fail.  Definately not a slacker course.  Having a good TA definately helps. Beaware of his famous multiple choice questions, for he is very creative.  He covers too much too soon.

He is an ineffective teacher because he is such an expert in his field and assumes we all are too. Not the case though ... he should take a look at the marks on his exams and evaluate his teaching ability. He covers difficult material in way too short a time span and does this at an extremely rapid pace. Not a class I would recommend taking.

Well...yeah, the exams are tough but he made the final a bit easier because we complained about the midterm being confusing. Study the textbook, pay attention in class and you can do well. Not very interactive with the class, just lectures from notes at high speed.
No Comments

i hate this course, dun even understand what he says. i dun think he knows how to control the class. yeah he's easy on the eyes but the exams are frickin' hard... and there's no point in understanding it... i failed this course. dun take it if you wanna pass easy.

Man, I don't know what is wrong with a lot of the people last semester, but Spalek was a good prof. If people actually read the textbook and comprehended it, you can do very well in the course. I am not an A student by any means, but I found this course to be an easy A.

Avoid taking this courses if possible, his teaching methods are absurb and very difficult to comprehend.  There is a lot of material, he expects you to memorize each and every study which is a lot. Exams: 60 M.C Q's. - which are tricky questions.  I did well, but studied way 2 much for a 2nd yr cour
He seems like a cool cool person but his exams are confusing & hard. Otherwise hes cool

Midterm is hard, but m/c, so read the text book and follow his notes and you'll do fine. Quizes in tutorial keep you on track and up to date. Overall, his lectures are pretty informative; he uses lots of examples to understand better; but really you could just listen online rather than go to class.
like everyone has said, extremely nice guy. but his midterm was brutal! very confusing (wordy), however he did try to make the final a bit easier.

He seems to know his stuff and uses examples/experiments to help portray his ideas.  His exams (60m/c) are difficult because he tries to trick you with neg. phrases in quest and neg. in answer.  Overall a good prof.
Very difficult class, only take it if you are serious about the topic
covers material pretty well, how do you find the exams?

Great prof, he cares about the material and teaches well. he's also just a fun guy. Only reason for the 3/5 difficulty was the lectures were 3 hours and there's a ton of info. He always let us out 30 mins- an hour early though which was great. Take home exams were quite long papers, but we had 2-3 weeks so cant complain. def recommend

Richard's PSYC221 class is engaging and informative. Though the take-home exams can be challenging, his clear passion for the material makes lectures enjoyable. unstuck AI proved a helpful study tool alongside the textbook.

You can tell that Richard loves teaching and has a clear passion for psychology. Not only did he help you to understand the concepts in a clear way, he also helped prepare students for grad school and planning ahead.

Richard is a very funny and interesting person and I enjoyed taking the class with him. I found the quizzes to be a bit difficult if you don't put in a solid amount of effort in studying but the take-home exams were relatively straightforward and the readings were usually not too long and pretty interesting.

Dr. Wright was my favourite prof this semester. Take home exams are tough but you have two weeks to work on them and he tells you the grading criteria at the beginning of the semester - start early and you'll be fine (they're like a paper you need to research for, not a regular exam). Quizzes are fair and cover lecture and readings.

This class seemed slightly unfair tbh. 2 take-home exams were 30% each and consisted of content we hadn't even learned yet. A strict 1500-word count wasn't enough. The 5 quizzes were fair if you took the time to read the textbook, but overall, I just found the lectures pointless. Richard is a very sweet man though, and he sent frequent reminders.

epic prof. even though his lectures weren't mandatory, i found myself looking forward to them every week :)) his lectures are super engaging and you can tell that he loves the material he teaches. make sure to start the written exams early and not leave them until the last minute!

Dr. Wright was so wonderful! His teaching method is amazing! I found that I never lost focus (even though it was a 3 hour lecture). His quizzes were fair, and I found that the take-home exam papers were actually kind of fun to do! If you have the chance, take the class with him!

Professor Wright is such a great prof, I really enjoyed the class. He sometimes gets lost in the lecture, but he makes the lecture engaging and funny so it doesn't affect the flow of the class that much. He is so approachable and it's clear that he loves the material he teaches. His class sometimes feels like a fever dream but in a good way?

A professor that loves what he does! His class is really interesting and easy to get through. 3 take-home exams covering topics that we haven't learned about. I thought it was going to be difficult at first, but they are fairly simple plus you learn a lot. 5 quizzes and he omits the quiz with the lowest score. I highly recommend taking his classes!
so handsome, very #relatable, talks about his wife, silly guy.

Dr. Wright is really funny and made the lecture material (which I found pretty dry) fairly easy to listen to. His lectures are sort of disorganized, and the take home exams are tough. If you want a good grade on them, start early!

Such a great prof!! If youre a strong writer you will definitely do well because there are 3 take home exams. Hes a super knowledgeable and kind guy. Definitely recommend him for 221 and looking forward to 330 with him

Amazing prof - one of the best at SFU! Explains concepts clearly and assignments fully allow students to demonstrate their knowledge. He often adds personal funny stories/anecdotes to his lectures which just make his lessons all the more engaging and interesting! Highly recommend

He's very nice and gave lots of examples that related to the concepts that he was talking about in class and was easy to follow. Course content itself wasn't too hard to understand, but overall grade depends on how essays are graded and what questions are asked on quizzes.

Taking this class with Dr. Wright was one of the best decisions I have made. He made the course very interesting and coming to class felt less like an obligation and more like something I wanted to do by choice. I also loved the fact that our grades were based on papers instead of exams, which gave us the chance to research and apply what we learnt

Each paper will be 2500-300 words, and he'll give you 3 weeks to write one. I would recommend attending all lectures so you'll have basic knowledge of the topics you will be writing about in your papers. The papers will be marked lightly by the TAs, and the marks you'll received will be mainly based on topics following the lectures.

Dr. Wright is an amazing professor! He is very caring and genuinely cares about his students. However, there are 3 assignments worth 30% each and the instructions and rubric are not very clear. Assignments also had no feedback so I had no idea what needed to be improved. Quizzes worth 10% total, unlimited attempts! So it's like a free 10%.

I was quite hesitant about taking this course online this semester, but Richard Wright made the class experience great. His lectures are very interesting to listen to and you can see he really is passionate about it as well. There were weekly quizzes that you could redo till you got full marks that were worth 10% altogether and three thought papers

Dr. Wright is such an amazing professor! He's very supportive and caring towards his students, and is always willing to provide a helping hand. There's no other prof out there like him. Take him if you have the chance!

Probably the sweetest prof I've ever had. Such a nice guy. The course content was quite basic so really appreciated the recorded lectures that I could watch at double speed (Covid). Thought papers were a lot of work but I found them more interesting than the lecture content because you could explore topics more deeply. Will take his harder courses.

Dr Wright is probably one of my fav profs ever! He's so passionate about the material he is teaching and is keen to answer any questions. Super friendly and approachable, he's really reasonable and just all around a great prof. 100% recommend taking whatever class of his you can!

Wright cares about students and gives fantastic lectures. I never read the textbook and still got an A+ just from studying the lecture material. Would recommend going to class since he doesn't upload his lecture slides. Lectures are recorded and posted online. Easy and fun class

Quite possibly my FAVOURITE prof at SFU. I was worried because I read previous reviews before taking the class, but taking this class was the best thing I ever did at SFU. Richard is super nice and his lectures are pretty interesting, rebut keep in mind he has very little text on his slides. Based on lectures alone, it's easy to follow along.

heres my update (after spending 1 semester with him) (I couldn't edit a previous review oops). I LOVE RICHARD SO MUCH. the whole class loved him. he is so friendly and pure and records lectures to keep them accessible. exams are multiple choice, "pick which is false". so nice during office hours, takes student feedback. he is a libra

He made the lectures very funny, entertaining and easy to understand. Lectures are not mandatory because he records, but would recommend going because they are that engaging and enjoyable! At the end of final lecture the entire class applauded him. Do yourself a favour and take a course with Wright!
I LOVE HIM he's so funny and entertaining and engaging and it's only the first class. May update this later

Dr. Wright is an awesome prof!! Anything you need to know for the exam are in his lectures slides. He has about 3 papers and his test are all multiple choice. But if you paid attention in class and studied the slides, you will do great in this course. Would definitely take another course with him!

His lecture slides are mostly pictures, blank space, & little text. He also shows a lot of examples & demos to explain theories. There is no need to copy everything he says. Study the textbook, even topics he didn't cover for the exam. Assignments are just a few short paragraphs applying theories to personal examples, use vocab from textbook.
Attended lectures and read textbook, easy A for me

He is always here to help students understand course materials, and welcomes students to interact in class. In order to get into the A range, you must take really good lecture notes and read the readings before hand. He also shares information about applying to grad school and lab research opportunities.

Interesting lectures that are recorded which is useful when studying. No lecture slides as he mostly just talks for the lecture so make sure to take good notes. 85% of your mark comes from tests so you want to make sure to study lots! It's mainly focused on lecture materials but to get an A you need to also know textbook material as well.

extremely engaging lectures, doesnt pack lecture slides with what you need to know so you can pay attention to what hes saying. also gives interesting examples for each topic. course is about half lecture half textbook

Dr. Wright's lectures are amazing and fun and provided alot of examples that helps explain the contents. Mid terms and Finals are all MCQs, based mostly on his lectures. Be attentive in classes and do your readings before hand. Though this course is memorization-based, take good notes and read over them before exam can give you at least a B range.

Just another mediocre prof, biggest issue I have with him is the format of his exams as they are needlessly difficult. There's is so much content to memorize and the True and False MC is comprised of the most trivial, random facts. It's completely absurd.

Awesome Prof!! Genuinely cares for his students and it's one of those classes in which you can actually pay attention for the full 2.5 hrs. To get an A - take rly good notes, read the textbook, don't cram. Exams are MC and each question is worth a lot (almost .8%) so don't overlook things in the notes or text. 80% + will get you in the A range.

I'm going to be real here.. this class was so extremely easy. If you have any science background you don't even have to go to class - I only went to the midterm and final. I don't understand most of these other ratings. Buy the textbook, read it, write the test, and get an A. Everything is in the book.  10/10 so easy would recommend

He is a nice guy, offers good insight into subject material. However, to do well in this course, you must make good notes or team up with classmates and review notes. In addition, study the textbook really well. His questions are comprised of true and false multiple choice which can be confusing. As long as you are actively studying, you are solid.

Never went to class, instead listened to the lecture recordings online. Lecture outline maps were helpful for studying for the MT and final, which could be a bit tricky. Thought questions were relatively easy. Textbook was necessary. Overall, a mediocre course. Wouldn't recommend to non-psych majors though.
You have to attend all the lecture because there is no any notes. You have to jot it yourself, and he always jump from topic to topic, which is hard to follow.
Course is interesting, but exams are tricky. Prof is nice and helpful. 3 thought questions are easy. Recommend this course.
Exams are worth a lot, so pay attention during lectures! The mind maps are a helpful guide to see which areas to focus on for the midterm and the final. Overall, a great class :D

He was a helpful prof, but some of the material was boring. Because there were no slides, it was confusing as to what to study. His texts were all MC but were worded weirdly, and the weighting for exams is too high. Why is Midterm 40%?? Don't take unless needed.

LOVED THIS CLASS! Dr. Wright is an amazing probably one of my favorite profs at SFU! 3 hour lectures went by super fast since he keeps the class interesting from start to end. 3 thought papers (600 words max) are super easy! For the midterm and final if you do decent amount of studying they're a breeze, all mc! Highly recommend taking this class.

Unfortunately, he only talks in lectures, but doesnt provide ANY lecture notesslides. That basically results in you having to try too hard to write down every important word instead of listening attentively. I think he makes it very easy for himself this way. The readings are the most important thing for this course.

This class worried me due to the heavy weighted exams (midterm 40% and Final 45%) but if you go to class every week and do the chapter readings the MC questions are a breeze - requires a lot of memorization, but what psyc class doesn't? the thought question papers are pretty straightforward although they are worth 5% each - do them easy 15% to get
Assignment are not hard but exams weight a lot. Have to pay attention to class and take notes.

Richard is an awesome prof. This course is extremely easy to pass! Just read the textbook and take good notes in lecture. Thought questions are also really easy to ace - just think outside the box and use previous notes from past psychology courses. Memorization is key. Lectures are mostly for fun, but you DO need to attend!
He is a really nice professor and is helpful and approachable.  The exams are all MC and require you to know the text in detail.  He was a bit disorganized though, especially when it came to exams!

Dr. Wright is a really funny guy, kind-hearted and very friendly. He keeps lectures engaging which is awesome. Problem: doesn't post lecture slides, have to read the textbook to do well on the exams (even though he doesn't talk about text in lecture) and it is unclear as to what to study. Exams are all MC which is nice though! Must attend lecture

Richard is an awesome prof! He explains things really well and his classes are always interesting! His thought questions and exams are very fair - you HAVE to study for this class if you want a good mark. His corny jokes are silly but they work. I really enjoyed having him as a prof.

He keeps the lectures fun with up to date references and lots of video samples. His lectures are recorded like others mentioned, but can't rely on the quality and his lecture slides are not posted online. so you should attend class as exams cover them all. Overall I enjoyed it so much with his honest perceptions about textbook studies.

This class was extremely hard for me. You need to go to every lecture & take notes because he doesn't have a real pwr pt or even FITB notes, and the textbook is hard to study. Be warned that the exams and assignments are hard!

Best prof at SFU! He is funny without meaning to be. I usually hate paying attention in lecture, but he made lectures fun and very interesting. Textbook chapters were short and easy to understand. He tests mostly on what he says during lecture. Thought papers were easy, but put some thought into them! I would highly recommend Dr. Wright!

Despite it being a 3hr class we never went for the full time, as 3hrs can be a long lecture!! Kept it interesting and easy to do well on midterm and final exam if you either go to lectures or listen to the recordings. Should also at least read through text material once. Thought questions a little harder... TAs were very vague on what they wanted.
very dull, completely useless to e-mail as the response will be extremely brief, the three hours seemed a lot longer.

I HATED this class. The complete lack of guidance in terms of notes makes the 3 hour lecture impossible to follow. Will avoid in the future FOR SURE

Awesome prof! He's really nice and wants you to do well. The textbook is key. Read it before going to lecture. You have to take good notes cuz its not on the slides. The exams are fair. Study the book and review notes a week in advance and youre pretty much guaranteed an A. No last minute studying!
One of the best Profs I've ever had at SFU. Very passionate, helpful, and nice. Make sure you take good notes. Exams are all MCs but do require some effort. Wish could take more courses with him.
Loved this prof! The lectures were really interesting. Exams and assignments were fair.

Great class! Midterm and final are all multiple choice and mostly non-cumulative. The material on the exams came equally from the text and lecture. Pay attention to his examples, there are some questions about them on the exams. Also, class is on a curve I got between 80-90% on my exams, ended up with an A+.

An absolute delight of a prof! Mostly tested on stuff from the textbook. I found the lectures interesting though many people thought they were boring.  Exams are fair with a couple of trick questions.
